channel.title: ExtendedCompiler
channel.description:
This is a console application called ExtendedCompiler, i created this because some sources have compilers that do not work or work bad. This lets you compile your server/client and run your server/client in one easy application. There is also a config file where you can set your JDK path and the command to run your server or client (example: -Xmx800M EGUI).
This does not come with the config file, once you start the application select the "x" option to create a new config. To set the JDK path; open the config and only change the "jdk...etc.." to your JDK's folder name.
[b]Benefits[/b]: Compile & run in one application + config file to set JDK's folder name (example: jdk1.7.0_01).
[b]Screenshots[/b]:
[img]http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/13/63174211.png[/img] [url=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/13/63174211.png]http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/13/63174211.png[/url]
[img]http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/46/77829501.png[/img] [url=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/46/77829501.png]http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/46/77829501.png[/url]
[img]http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/836/11332431.png[/img] [url=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/836/11332431.png]http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/836/11332431.png[/url]
[img]http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/703/45279708.png[/img] [url=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/703/45279708.png]http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/703/45279708.png[/url]
[b]Virusscan[/b]: [url=http://www.virustotal.com/file-scan/report.html?id=128d9d5dc2609e79bc4dadffe22164cc3f6f08f07af54799ccf1e57b82a6e993-1325693358]http://www.virustotal.com/file-scan/report.html?id=128d9d5dc2609e79bc4dadffe22164cc3f6f08f07af54799ccf1e57b82a6e993-1325693358[/url] False positive?
[b]Download[/b]: [url=http://www.mediafire.com/?pbmbgd9ecynvbs7]http://www.mediafire.com/?pbmbgd9ecynvbs7[/url]
[i]Please leave your feedback so i can make this better.[/i]

item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

Thanks for contributing. This would be useful for new-comers, but not so much for people who know what they’re doing.

item.title: ExtendedCompiler
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

I already have this
It’s not that hard

edit.
Virus a lot? why did u make it an exe

edit2:
Looks safe at first sight

source code:

@echo off :menu cls title ExtendedCompiler echo ExtendedCompiler for P0WER-XXL. if "%ProgramFiles(x86)%XXX"=="XXX" ( set "ProgRoot=%ProgramFiles%" ) else ( set "ProgRoot=%ProgramFiles(x86)%" ) for /f "tokens=1,2 delims==" %%a in (ExtendedCompiler.cfg) do ( if %%a==JDKPATH set JDKPATH=%%b if %%a==RUNSERV set RUNSERV=%%b ) echo. echo. echo Type "c" to Compile server/client. echo Type "r" to Run your server/client. echo Type "i" to View system information. echo Type "x" to Create a new ExtendedCompiler.cfg. echo. echo. set /p c=Option: if %c%==c goto compile if %c%==C goto compile if %c%==r goto runserver if %c%==R goto runserver if %c%==i goto sysinfo if %c%==I goto sysinfo if %c%==x goto newconf if %c%==X goto newconf :compile cls title ExtendedCompiler - Compiler echo Please wait. . . echo. "%ProgRoot%\Java\%JDKPATH%\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *java echo. echo Finished! pause goto menu :newconf cls title ExtendedCompiler - New ExtendedCompiler.cfg echo Deleting ExtendedCompiler.cfg, if exists. . . del ExtendedCompiler.cfg echo Creating new ExtendedCompiler.cfg. . . echo This is the path to your JDK folder.>> ExtendedCompiler.cfg echo Change this if your system can't find the path when compiling.>> ExtendedCompiler.cfg echo JDKPATH=jdk1.7.0_01>> ExtendedCompiler.cfg echo.>> ExtendedCompiler.cfg echo This is the command to run your server or client.>> ExtendedCompiler.cfg echo Change this to your server or client's needs.>> ExtendedCompiler.cfg echo RUNSERV=-Xmx800M EGUI>> ExtendedCompiler.cfg echo Finished! pause goto menu :sysinfo cls title ExtendedCompiler - System information ver | findstr /i "5\.0\." > nul IF %ERRORLEVEL% EQU 0 goto ver_2000 ver | findstr /i "5\.1\." > nul IF %ERRORLEVEL% EQU 0 goto ver_XP ver | findstr /i "5\.2\." > nul IF %ERRORLEVEL% EQU 0 goto ver_2003 ver | findstr /i "6\.0\." > nul IF %ERRORLEVEL% EQU 0 goto ver_Vista ver | findstr /i "6\.1\." > nul IF %ERRORLEVEL% EQU 0 goto ver_Win7 echo %vers% | find "Windows Server 2008" > nul if %ERRORLEVEL% == 0 goto ver_2008 goto warn_and_exit :ver_Win7 echo Operating System: Windows 7. if "%ProgramFiles(x86)%XXX"=="XXX" ( echo This is a 32-bit operating system. set "ProgRoot=%ProgramFiles%" ) else ( set "ProgRoot=%ProgramFiles(x86)%" echo This is a 64-bit operating system. ) echo Program files folder: %ProgRoot%\ echo. echo JDK path: %ProgRoot%\Java\%JDKPATH%\ echo Javac path: %ProgRoot%\Java\%JDKPATH%\bin\javac.exe echo. echo Runserver command: %RUNSERV%. echo. pause goto menu :ver_Vista echo Operating System: Windows Vista. if "%ProgramFiles(x86)%XXX"=="XXX" ( echo This is a 32-bit operating system. set "ProgRoot=%ProgramFiles%" ) else ( set "ProgRoot=%ProgramFiles(x86)%" echo This is a 64-bit operating system. ) echo Program files folder: %ProgRoot%\ echo. echo JDK path: %ProgRoot%\Java\%JDKPATH%\ echo Javac path: %ProgRoot%\Java\%JDKPATH%\bin\javac.exe echo. echo Runserver command: %RUNSERV%. echo. pause goto menu :ver_2003 echo Operating System: Windows Server 2003. if "%ProgramFiles(x86)%XXX"=="XXX" ( echo This is a 32-bit operating system. set "ProgRoot=%ProgramFiles%" ) else ( set "ProgRoot=%ProgramFiles(x86)%" echo This is a 64-bit operating system. ) echo Program files folder: %ProgRoot%\ echo. echo JDK path: %ProgRoot%\Java\%JDKPATH%\ echo Javac path: %ProgRoot%\Java\%JDKPATH%\bin\javac.exe echo. echo Runserver command: %RUNSERV%. echo. pause goto menu :ver_XP echo Operating System: Windows XP. if "%ProgramFiles(x86)%XXX"=="XXX" ( echo This is a 32-bit operating system. set "ProgRoot=%ProgramFiles%" ) else ( set "ProgRoot=%ProgramFiles(x86)%" echo This is a 64-bit operating system. ) echo Program files folder: %ProgRoot%\ echo. echo JDK path: %ProgRoot%\Java\%JDKPATH%\ echo Javac path: %ProgRoot%\Java\%JDKPATH%\bin\javac.exe echo. echo Runserver command: %RUNSERV%. echo. pause goto menu :ver_2000 echo Operating System: Windows 2000. if "%ProgramFiles(x86)%XXX"=="XXX" ( echo This is a 32-bit operating system. set "ProgRoot=%ProgramFiles%" ) else ( set "ProgRoot=%ProgramFiles(x86)%" echo This is a 64-bit operating system. ) echo Program files folder: %ProgRoot%\ echo. echo JDK path: %ProgRoot%\Java\%JDKPATH%\ echo Javac path: %ProgRoot%\Java\%JDKPATH%\bin\javac.exe echo. echo Runserver command: %RUNSERV%. echo. pause goto menu :ver_2008 echo Operating System: Windows Server 2008 if "%ProgramFiles(x86)%XXX"=="XXX" ( echo This is a 32-bit operating system. set "ProgRoot=%ProgramFiles%" ) else ( set "ProgRoot=%ProgramFiles(x86)%" echo This is a 64-bit operating system. ) echo Program files folder: %ProgRoot%\ echo. echo JDK path: %ProgRoot%\Java\%JDKPATH%\ echo Javac path: %ProgRoot%\Java\%JDKPATH%\bin\javac.exe echo. echo Runserver command: %RUNSERV%. echo. pause goto menu :warn_and_exit echo Operating System cannot be determined. if "%ProgramFiles(x86)%XXX"=="XXX" ( echo This is a 32-bit operating system. set "ProgRoot=%ProgramFiles%" ) else ( set "ProgRoot=%ProgramFiles(x86)%" echo This is a 64-bit operating system. ) echo Program files folder: %ProgRoot%\ echo. echo JDK path: %ProgRoot%\Java\%JDKPATH%\ echo Javac path: %ProgRoot%\Java\%JDKPATH%\bin\javac.exe echo. echo Runserver command: %RUNSERV%. echo. pause goto menu :runserver cls title ExtendedCompiler - Run server start java %RUNSERV% goto menu

This is a console application called ExtendedCompiler, i created this because some sources have compilers that do not work or work bad.
This lets you compile your server/client and run your server/client in one easy application.
There is also a config file where you can set your JDK path and the command to run your server or client (example: -Xmx800M EGUI).
